citeinfo.origin: U.S. Geological Survey, Biological Resources Division, Patuxent Wildlife Research Center
citeinfo.title: Brood Parasitism on Neotropical Migrants

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Geological Survey, Biological Resources Division, Patuxent Wildlife Research Center

descript.abstract: Bayesian models provide a structure for studying collections of parameters such as are considered in the investigation of communities, ecosystems, and andscapes. This structure allows for improved estimation of individual parameters by considering them in the context of a group of related parameters. Individual estimates are differentially adjusted toward an overall mean, with the magnitude of their adjustment based on their precision. Consequently, Bayesian estimation allows for a more reliable ranking of parameters and, in particular, a more credible identification of extreme values from a collection of estimates.
descript.purpose: To assess the effect of brood parasitism on neotropical migrants.
descript.supplinf: The information for this metadata was taken in part from the U.S. Geological Survey, Biological Resources Division, Patuxent Wildlife Research Center Research Showcase site for the appropriate data set http://www.pwrc.usgs.gov/resshow1.htm. Internal Filename - usgsbrdpwrc00000022; This is the "child" metadata for the larger work Brood Parasitism on Tropical Migrants, Caldwell Hahn - Internal Filename - usgsbrdpwrc00000013. A digital copy of this metadata file is available in text, html, and sgml format on the National Biological Information Infrastructure (NBII) Metadata Clearinghouse.
